title: Brazil’s Gomes replaces Suzuki as Nats’ World Series catcher
text:
Houston (AFP) – Brazilian catcher Yan Gomes was inserted into the lineup for the Washington Nationals on Wednesday in place of injured Kurt Suzuki for World Series game seven showdown with Houston.

The Astros and Nationals are deadlocked 3-3 in Major League Baseball’s best-of-seven final, with road teams having won every game thus far, an unprecedented feat in North American sport.

Suzuki suffered a hip flexor injury in Washington’s game-four loss and has been replaced by since then by Gomes.

Nationals manager Dave Martinez had put Suzuki into the lineup for the winner-take-all showdown but announced before the game that Suzuki would not be ready and Gomes would make the start behind the plate.

It will be the first World Series game seven to feature two Cy Young Award (best pitcher) winners with Washington’s Max Scherzer going against Houston’s Zack Greinke.
description: Houston (AFP) – Brazilian catcher Yan Gomes was inserted into the lineup for the Washington Nationals on Wednesday in place of injured Kurt Suzuki
